member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.UseHierarchy
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether hierarchy should be used when finding the route.
member.value: if hierarchy should be used; otherwise .

remarks.para: Using a hierarchy results in the service preferring higher-order streets such as freeways to lower-order streets such as local roads. A parameter value of true indicates that the service should use hierarchy and can be used to simulate the driver preference of traveling on freeways instead of local roads even if that means a longer trip. This is especially true when finding long distance routes, as the driver will usually prefer to travel on freeways as much as possible and avoid the local roads. Using hierarchy is computationally faster, especially for long distance routes, as the service has to select the best route from a relatively smaller subset of streets. A parameter value of false indicates that the service should consider all the streets and not prefer higher-order streets when finding the route. This is often used when finding short-distance routes like routes within a city.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired start time for the route to begin.

remarks.para: The time value is interpreted as local to the time zone in which the street closest to the first stop is located.

Some services, such as the ArcGIS Online Route Service, support live traffic information. The value for the startTime parameter determines if the service should use live traffic speeds. If the current date and time are specified as the parameter value, live traffic speeds are used when finding the best route. Otherwise traffic speeds based on historical averages are used. For countries that do not support live or historical traffic speeds, the service always finds the route based on posted speed limits. If the parameter is not specified, the service will use a value of none which indicates that a start time should not be used. Consequently, the route will always be based on the posted speed limits.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.UseTimeWindows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether time windows on the stops should be considered when calculating the best route. The default is false. The time windows are specified on stops using the TimeWindowStart and TimeWindowEnd attributes.
member.value: if time windows should be considered; otherwise .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.FindBestSequence
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the analysis should reorder stops to find the optimized route. The default is false.
member.value: if stops should be reordered; otherwise .

remarks.para: If the parameter value is false, the analysis returns a route that visits stops in the order you define. If the parameter value is true, the analysis finds the best order to visit the stops. You can elect to preserve the origin and/or the destination stops while allowing the service to reorder intermediary stops by setting and parameters.

Note that a value of true causes the analysis to switch from solving a shortest-path problem to a traveling salesperson problem (TSP). Solving a TSP is computer-intensive operation and if using an online subscription-based service may incur additional service credits per route.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.PreserveFirstStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the analysis should preserve the first stop. This parameter is applicable only if is true.
member.value: if the first stop should be preserved when reordering stops; otherwise .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.PreserveLastStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the analysis should preserve the last stop. This parameter is applicable only if is true.
member.value: if the last stop should be preserved when reordering stops; otherwise .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.OutputLines
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of route features that are output by the service. This property is applicable only if the parameter is set to true.
member.value: A value of representing the desired output lines.

remarks.para:
The output line type may be one of:
No geometries returned for the route.
Straight lines between the stops.
The exact geometry based on the underlying streets.
The exact geometry with measure information.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.OutSpatialReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial reference of the output geometries such as the routes or the stops.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnDirections
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether driving directions between the stops should be generated. The default is true.
member.value: if driving directions should be generated; otherwise .

remarks.para: A true value indicates that the directions will be generated and configured based on the values for the , , and parameters.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.DirectionsLengthUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear units in which the length information will be reported in the directions.
member.value: A representing the linear units reported in the directions.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.DirectionsLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the language that should be used when generating driving directions. This parameter is used only when the is set to true.
member.value: A representing the desired directions language. For example "en" represents English.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.DirectionsStyleName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the directions style.
member.value: A representing the name of the directions style.

remarks.para:
Valid values for this property are:
"NA Desktop": Turn-by-turn directions suitable for printing.
"NA Navigation": Turn-by-turn directions designed for an in-vehicle navigation device.
"NA Campus": Turn-by-turn walking directions, which are designed for pedestrian routes.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnPointBarriers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether point barriers should be returned. The default is false. This parameter is applicable only if you have specified the value for the Point Barriers.
member.value: if point barriers should be returned; otherwise .

remarks.para: Returning barriers can allow you to draw the point barrier locations in your application (if you do not already have access to them within your application). You may also want to set the returnBarriers property to true in order to determine if the point barriers were successfully located on the street network or had some other errors by checking the property.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnPolylineBarriers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether polyline barriers should be returned. The default is false. This parameter is applicable only if you have specified the value for the Polyline Barriers.
member.value: if polyline barriers should be returned; otherwise .

remarks.para: Returning barriers can allow you to draw the polyline barrier locations in your application (if you do not already have access to them within your application).

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnPolygonBarriers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether polygon barriers should be returned. The default is false. This parameter is applicable only if you have specified the value for the Polygon Barriers.
member.value: if polygon barriers should be returned; otherwise .

remarks.para: Returning barriers can allow you to draw the polygon barrier locations in your application (if you do not already have access to them within your application).

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnZ
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Z values should be returned.
member.value: if Z values should be returned; otherwise .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.IgnoreInvalidLocations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether invalid locations should be ignored.
member.value: if invalid locations should be ignored; otherwise .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnRoutes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the analysis should return routes. The default is true. The shape of the routes depends on the value for the property.
member.value: if routes should be returned; otherwise .

remarks.para: There are certain cases when it is not desirable to use a value of true for returnRoutes parameter. For example, if your application has to display only the driving directions between the stops, it is sufficient to just set the property to true to get the desired result. Setting the ReturnRoutes to true will not provide any additional information and will increase the overall response size which may not be suitable for certain applications such as those running on devices with low bandwidth data connections.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.ReturnStops
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the input stops should be returned. The default is false.
member.value: if stops should be returned; otherwise .

remarks.para: When finding optimized routes, the ReturnStops property can be set to true to determine the optimal sequence in which the route visits a particular stop by checking the Sequence attribute of the stop . You may also want to set the ReturnStops property to true in order to determine if the stops were successfully located on the street network or had some other errors by checking the property.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.OutputGeometryPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount the result route geometry is simplified.

remarks.para: Simplification maintains critical points on a route, such as turns at intersections, to define the essential shape of the route and removes other points. The simplification distance you specify is the maximum allowable offset that the simplified line can deviate from the original line. Simplifying a line reduces the number of vertices that are part of the route geometry. This reduces the overall response size and also improves the performance for drawing the route shapes in the application. The default value for this parameter is 10. The units are specified with the outputGeometryPrecisionUnits parameter.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.RouteParameters.OutputGeometryPrecisionUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the units for the value set in . The default value is .
member.value: A value representing the linear unit for simplification.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.NetworkAnalyst.NetworkDescription.RestrictionUsageParameterValues
member.summary: The restriction usage parameter values.

remarks.para: Restrictions can be identified for particular elements such that, during an analysis, traversing restricted elements is prohibited entirely, avoided, or even preferred. The values in this list which are assigned to the restriction usage parameter determines whether the restriction attribute prohibits, avoids, or prefers the network elements it is associated with. Furthermore, the degree to which network elements are avoided or preferred can be defined by choosing High, Medium, or Low.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.#ctor(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.ArcGISServices.FeatureServiceInfo,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Geometry.Geometry)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for generating a geodatabase. The geodatabase created with this constructor will contain all the layers in the feature service indicated by featureServiceInfo. No attachments will be returned.
member.param: featureServerInfo information on feature service that will be used to create this geodatabase.

The geometry to apply as the spatial filter. All the features in layers intersecting this geometry will be replicated. If the geometry doesn't have a spatial reference, it's assumed to be in the spatial reference of the service.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Geometry.Geometry)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The geometry to apply as the spatial filter. All the features in layers intersecting this geometry will be replicated. If the geometry doesn't have a spatial reference, it's assumed to be in the spatial reference of the service.
member.exception: A list of layers and tables to include in the geodatabase.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.#ctor(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.ReplicaOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Parameter used to create replica based on existing replica definition or register existing data.

member.summary: Populates the dictionary with teh properties form this class ready for json serialization.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.LayerIDs
member.summary: Gets the list of layers and tables to include in the geodatabase.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.GeometryFilter
member.summary: The geometry to apply as the spatial filter. All the features in layers intersecting this geometry will be replicated.
member.remarks: If the is not set, then the spatial reference of the geometry filter is used for the output spatial reference.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.ReturnAttachments
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to return attachments.
member.value: true if geodatabase should include attachments; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If true, attachments are added to the geodatabase and returned in the response. Otherwise, attachments are not included. The default is false. This parameter is only applicable if the feature service has attachments.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.GeodatabasePrefixName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the geodatabase (optional).
member.remarks: This is not a required parameter. If not specified, a name will be assigned and returned in the create response. If specified, but the name already exists on the server, a unique name will be returned in the response using the given geodatabase name as a base (i.e "MyGeodatabase" may be returned as "MyGeodatabase_0" if there is already a replica named "MyGeodatabase" on the server).

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.SyncModel
member.summary: This parameter is used to indicate that the geodatabase is being created for per layer sync or per geodatabase sync.

remarks.para: By default, a geodatabase is created for per geodatabase sync. If SyncModel is PerGeodatabase, the sync direction specified during sync applies to all layers in the geodatabase. If the SyncModel is PerLayer, the sync direction is defined on a layer by layer basis.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.LayerQueries
member.summary: Gets or sets individual layer queries.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.OutSpatialReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial reference that the data should be exported to
member.remarks: If null, the spatial reference is used. If that is also null the services default spatial reference is used.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.GenerateGeodatabaseParameters.ReplicaOptions
member.summary: This parameter instructs create replica operation to create a new replica based on an existing replica definition (refReplicaId). It can be used to specify parameters for registration of existing data for sync. The create replica operation will create a replica, but will not return data.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.LayerQuery.UseGeometry
member.summary: Determines whether or not to apply the geometry for the layer. The default is true. If set to false, features from the layer that intersect the geometry are not added.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.LayerQuery.IncludeRelated
member.summary: Determines whether or not to add related rows. The default is true. Value true is honored only for is . This is only applicable if your data has relationship classes.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.LayerQuery.QueryOption
member.summary: Defines whether and how filters will be applied to a laye

remarks.para: When the value is none, no features are returned based on where and filter geometry. If IncludeRelated is false, no features are returned. If IncludeRelated is true, features in this layer (that are related to the features in other layers in the geodatabase) are returned.
When the value is useFilter, features that satisfy filtering based on geometry and where are retuned. Value of IncludeRelated is ignored.
When the value is all, all the features from the layer are returned. All other parameters for the layer query are ignored.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.LayerQuery.Where
member.summary: Defines an attribute query for a layer or table. The default is no where clause.

member.summary: When the value is none, no features are returned based on where and filter geometry. If IncludeRelated is false, no features are returned. If IncludeRelated is true, features in this layer (that are related to the features in other layers in the geodatabase) are returned.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.QueryOption.UseFilter
member.summary: When the value is UseFilter, features that satisfy filtering based on geometry and where are retuned. Value of IncludeRelated is ignored.

member.name: F:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Offline.QueryOption.All
member.summary: When the value is all, all the features from the layer are returned. All other parameters for the layer query are ignored.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.FindTask
member.summary: Obtains a list of feature objects (i.e. rows in an attribute table including geometry) from an ArcGIS Server map service based upon a text string search of specified fields in a layer.

remarks.para: The FindTask performs a text based attribute search across the fields in an ArcGIS Server map service to retrieve features. It does not find features using an input geometry, for that use the IdentifyTask operation.

To use the FindTask, specify a Uri in the constructor that points to a ArcGIS Server map service (specifically a MapServer or FeatureServer). Then call the either the FindTask.ExecuteAsync(FindParameters) or FindTask.ExecuteAsync(FindParameters,CancellationToken) Method to obtain a System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList(Of FindItem) object that contains Features. Embedded in a Feature, you can gain access to attributes and geometry to display the FindTask results in your application.

They key to performing a FindTask is to specify the correct set of FindParameters to look for records in the ArcGIS Server map service. There are a few FindParameters Properties that are mandatory which must be set or else you will get an error in the results. These Properties are:

list.item: FindParameters.SearchText - The string you will be searching for in the attributes of the ArcGIS Server map service.
FindParameters.LayerIDs - The specific Integer layer ID values in the ArcGIS Server map service that you will be searching though to match the FindParameters.SearchText.

remarks.para: There are several other FindParameters Properties that can be set but they are not mandatory. Some of the more common that you may use include:

list.item: FindParameters.Contains - A boolean that determines if the FindParameters.SearchText being searched for in the attribute fields of the ArcGIS Server map service is case sensitive or not.

FindParameters.SearchFields - A list of strings that contains the exact field names that will be searched though in ArcGIS Server map service. If no FindParameters.SearchFields are specified, then all the fields in the ArcGIS Server map service are searched to match the FindParameters.SearchText.

remarks.para: TIP: Not all ArcGIS Server map services support the ability to use the FindTask. To figure out if a particular map service of ArcGIS Server does support this operation, the following set of steps can be used:
1. Copy the root level Url (aka. Uri) of the ArcGIS Server into a web browser:

img.alt: Use the root level Url (aka. Uri) in the address bar of the web browser.

remarks.para: 2. Click on a specific map service that is either a MapServer or a FeatureServer.

img.alt: Choose a map service.

remarks.para: 3. Scroll to the bottom of the page of the map service and look for the 'Support Operations' section and look a Find hyperlink. If the Find operation is present, then you can use the Query.FindTask operation.

img.alt: Choose a map service.

example.para: Demonstrates using the Query.FindTask operation to search for text in attribute fields of an ArcGIS Server map service and display the features found as graphics in a GraphicsLayer.

img.alt: Using the Query.FindTask to search for cities in the continental US.

member.summary: The spatial reference of the input and output geometries as well as the mapExtent. If sr is not specified, the geometry and the mapExtent are assumed to be in the spatial reference of the map, and the output geometries are also in the spatial reference of the map. The SpatialReference supports wkid as well as wkt for custom spatial references.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.LayerDefinitions
member.summary: Collection of layer definition expressions that allows you to filter the features of individual layers in the exported map image. Definition expressions for layers that are currently not visible will be ignored by the server.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.TimeExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the time instant or the time extent to identify.
member.remarks: Supported in ArcGIS REST Server v.10+

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.LayerTimeOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer time options. Time options can be set to indicate whether or not the layer should use the time extent specified by the time parameter or not, whether to draw the layer features cumulatively or not and the time offsets for the layer.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.LayerOption
member.summary:
Specifies which method to use when using Identify. "Top": Only the topmost visible layer is identified. "Visible": All visible layers are identified. "All": All layers are identified, even if they are not visible. Performance note: if your service has many layers, a request using "All" will not perform well. A visible layer means you can see it in the map at the current extent. If a layer is turned off or not in range based on its scale dependency settings, it cannot be identified.
To idenfity sub-layers that are not visible in the default map service definition, you may need to use the "All" option to return results.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.LayerIDs
member.summary:
Optional. When layer Ids are specified, the server treats it as a boolean "AND" operator. For example, if the LayerOption Visible is specified and the LayerIds are set to [2,5], only layers with Ids 2 and 5, if visible, are identified.
To idenfity sub-layers that are not visible in the default map service definition, you may need to use the "All" LayerOption to return results.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.Tolerance
member.summary: The distance in screen pixels from the specified geometry within which the identify should be performed.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyParameters.MapExtent
member.summary: The extent or bounding box of the map currently being viewed. Unless the SpatialReferenceWKID parameter has been specified, the mapExtent is assumed to be in the spatial reference of the map.

member.summary: If true, each returned feature includes the geometry. Since the geometry makes up a significant portion of the result, only use when you plan to use the geometry of the feature, for example, to include them on a map. By default, this is true.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.IdentifyTask
member.summary: Obtains a list of feature objects (i.e. rows in an attribute table including geometry) from an ArcGIS Server map service based upon geographic search.

remarks.para: The IdentifyTask performs a geographic based attribute search across specified layers in an ArcGIS Server map service to retrieve features. It does not find features using an attribute text search, for that use the FindTask operation.

To use the IdentifyTask, specify a Uri in the constructor that points to a ArcGIS Server map service (specifically a MapServer or FeatureServer). Then call the either the IdentifyTask.ExecuteAsync(IdentifyParameters) or IdentifyTask.ExecuteAsync(IdentifyParameters,CancellationToken) Method to obtain a System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList(Of IdentifyItem) object that contains Features. Embedded in a Feature, you can gain access to attributes and geometry to display the FindTask results in your application.

The key to performing an IdentifyTask is to specify the correct set of input arguments in the constructor of the IdentifyParameters object to obtain records based on a geographical search in the ArcGIS Server map service. These input arguments also match the Properties on the IdentifyParameters Class. They are:

list.item: IdentifyParameters.Geometry - The geometric shape used to search for features in the ArcGIS Server map service. Valid geometry types are Envelope, Point, Multipoint, Polyline, or Polygon.
IdentifyParameters.MapExtent - The extent of the map currently being viewed.
IdentifyParameters.Tolerance - The distance in screen pixels from the specified geometry within which the identify should be performed.
IdentifyParameters.Height - Height of the map currently being viewed in pixels.
IdentifyParameters.Width - Width of the map currently being viewed in pixels.

IdentifyParameters.Dpi - Resolution of the current map view in dots per inch. This is an optional input parameter argument to the IdentifyParameters constructor. The default Dpi value is 96. While 96 Dpi may have been typical for legacy Desktop and Laptop devices, care should be taken to using the correct Dpi for modern devices like phones, tablets, and other high resolution devices.

remarks.para: In most applications that make use of the IdentifyTask, you also need to specify other IdentifyParameters Properties beyond those that were specified in the constructor. The following are some of the other Properties that are not mandatory but highly useful:

list.item: IdentifyParameters.ReturnGeometry - The geometry of the feature found from the IdentifyTask operation. By default this boolean is set to true (meaning the geometry of the feature found is returned).

IdentifyParameters.SpatialReference - This is the SpatialReference of the ArcGIS Server map service. It is always a good idea to set this Property to be that of the MapView.SpatialReference. If the Spatial Reference of the ArcGIS Server map service and the MapView.SpatialReference are not the same, then the spatial search using the input geography will not find the correct results. If you find that in your application that you are clicking directly over a feature but you are not getting any results back, it is most likely the culprit that the Spatial Reference of the ArcGIS Server map service and the MapView.SpatialReference are not identical.

IdentifyParameters.LayerOption - This specifies which method is used in performing the geographic search. The default is that only the 'Top' visible layer is used. Other options are: 'All' meaning all layers are searched and 'Visible' meaning all visible layers are searched.

item.para: IdentifyParameters.LayerIDs - This specifies which Layers (via their Integer ID value) in the ArcGIS Server map service you want the geographical search to occur on, subject to the IdentifyParameters.LayerOption Property that has been set. If the ArcGIS Server map service contains multiple Layers displaying geographic information simultaneously, then experimentation may be required in adjusting the IdentifyParameters.LayerIDs and IdentifyParameters.LayerOption Properties to achieve the desired results.

TIP: (1) If you want to perform an Identify to get a geography for one specific layer, then set LayerOption = Top; (2) If you want to perform an Identify to to get a geography for two or more specific layers, then set LayerOption = All.

remarks.para: NOTE: The names of the fields that are returned in the Feature.Attributes as part of the IdentifyResults are actually the field aliases. This can have a huge impact on your application if you desire to use the actual field names as input to other operations in your application. In many cases field aliases cannot be used for further query type operations as the actual field names need to be used. If you need to obtain the actual field names and not the field aliases consider using the more powerful (yet more complex to use) operation. In many cases the field aliases and field names are often the same depending on how the ArcGIS Server map service was defined.

TIP: Not all ArcGIS Server map services support the ability to use the IdentifyTask. To figure out if a particular map service of ArcGIS Server does support this operation, the following set of steps can be used:
1. Copy the root level Url (aka. Uri) of the ArcGIS Server into a web browser:

img.alt: Use the root level Url (aka. Uri) in the address bar of the web browser.

remarks.para: 2. Click on a specific map service that is either a MapServer or a FeatureServer.

img.alt: Choose a map service.

remarks.para: 3. Scroll to the bottom of the page of the map service and look for the 'Support Operations' section and look a Identify hyperlink. If the Identify operation is present, then you can use the Query.IdentifyTask operation.

img.alt: Choose a map service.

example.para: Demonstrates using the Query.IdentifyTask operation find a feature based upon it's geographic position in an ArcGIS Server map service and display it as a graphic in a GraphicsLayer.

img.alt: Using the Query.IdentifyTask to get features based on a user touch.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.Query.Geometry
member.summary: The geometry to apply to the spatial filter. The spatial relationship as specified by spatialRelationship is applied to this geometry while performing the query. The valid geometry types are Envelope, Point, Multipoint, Polyline, or Polygon.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.Query.SpatialRelationship
member.summary: The spatial relationship to be applied on the input geometry while performing the query. The default is esriSpatialRelIntersects.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Tasks.Query.Query.RelationParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the SpatialRelDescription string that can be applied while performing the query operation.

remarks.para: This operation is only supported with ArcGIS Server v10.0 and higher.

The SpatialRelDescription is a nine character string describing the spatial relationships to be tested by the spatial filter. The SpatialRelDescription allows the comparison of any and all possible spatial intersections between two shapes. The intersection of each shapes boundary, interior, and exterior can be tested to allow the confirmation or various spatial relationships. All other spatial enumerators can be duplicated using this enumerator.
Shape relationships are defined by the intersection of their boundary, interior, and exterior.
Interior: The interior of a shape is defined as the entire shape minus its boundary. All shapes have interior.

Boundary: Linear and area shapes have boundary, but point shapes do not. The boundary of linear shapes consists of the end points of all linear parts. The boundary of area shapes consists of the linear boundary of the polygon shell(s).
Exterior: The area outside a shape. All shapes have an exterior.

Each element for the first shape, the query geometry, may be tested against each element of the second shape, the requested geometry, giving nine possible spatial intersections as listed in the table below:

The nine-characters string expected by ISpatialFilter::SpatialRelDescription, is used to specify whether the intersection of each of the elements in the array is true (T), false (F), or not tested (*).
For instance, in 'FFFTTT***', relationships 1-3 must be false, relationships 4-6 must be true, and relationships 7-9 are not tested.

para.i: Note that any two shapes' exteriors always intersect.

remarks.para: The following are some SpatialRelDescription string examples:

list.item: Shares a boundary: '****T***'
Shares a boundary and interiors intersect: 'T***T****'
Shares a boundary and interiors do not intersect: 'F***T****'
Does not touch the boundary and interiors intersect: 'T***F****'

remarks.para: For more information on this topic go to the following discusion on the Shape Comparison Language.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.FeatureCollection
member.summary: Instances of this class represent feature collections. A feature collection is a representation of one or more feature layers, where each layer contains the definition of that layer and the features that belong to that layer. In other words, the feaure layer contains all the information it needs to display map contents, and it does not rely on a backing map or feature service.

member.summary: Gets or sets a number representing the maximum scale at which the layer definition will be applied. member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.PopupInfo
member.summary:
Instances of this class represent popup definitions for features that need to be displayed in popups. Popup definitions contain information such as:
Which attributes of the feature should the popup display, whether they are editable, how to format numbers and dates, etc
Whether the popup should show attachments for the feature
What media, such as charts and images, should be displayed for the feature

member.summary: Gets or sets the description that is shown for the graphic in the popup. This can be html. If description is null then the fieldInfos are used when viewing attributes. This can contain a literal value, or a placeholder for value from the graphic's attribute. The placeholder needs to be of the form {field_name} where field_name is a key in the graphic's attributes.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.PopupInfo.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title that is displayed for the graphic in the popup. This can contain a literal value, or a placeholder for value from the graphic's attribute. The placeholder needs to be of the form {field_name} where field_name is a key in the graphic's attributes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the general structure of an SQL where clause to perform the query. The clause contains numbered placeholders such as {0} {1} which need to be replaced with predicates that are constructed from items in the parameters list.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.Query.VisibleFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the fields that must be returned in the results.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.Query.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameters representing the predicates to be used in the WhereClause.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.QueryParameter
member.summary: Instances of this class can be used to construct a predicate for . The application should provide UI to capture input from the user for each QueryParameter object in . This input can then be combined with the remaining information in the object to construct a predicate. For example, suppose the value of field is "Magnitude", Operator is "=", and the value entered by a user is 2. This information can be combined into a string "Magnitude = 2" which can then be used in a whereClause to query for earthqukes with a magnitude of 2.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.QueryParameter.DefaultValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value to compare with the field's value in the event that a user does not provide another value.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.QueryParameter.Field
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field (attribute) on which the query will be executed.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.QueryParameter.Prompt
member.summary: Gets or sets the message to be displayed to the user to indicate what the user input represents. For example, "Earthquake Magnitude:". This message should usually be displayed adjacent to the textfield.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.QueryParameter.HelpTip
member.summary: Gets or sets the help tip explaining what input would be valid. For example, "A value between 0 and 10".

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.QueryParameter.Operator
member.summary: Gets or sets the operator (<, >, =, etc) to be used to compare the field's value.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.LayerTree
member.summary: Helper class to convert the visibility of sublayers between 2 logics. Logic 1 (REST API) used by VisibleLayers : if a layer is visible --> all its children are displayed whatever the ascendants visibility Logic 2 (SOAP API, ISublayerVisibilitySupport interface, DefaultVisibility in LayerInfo, Legend/TOC UI) : a layer is displayed only if itself and its ascendants are visible.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.LayerTree.SetVisibleLayers(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Init the visibility of the layers from the visibleLayers array When a layer is in the array visibleLayers, it is visible (whatever the visibility of its parent) and all its descendants are visible so in the LayerTree we have to set the visibility for all ascendants and all descendants.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.LayerTree.GetVisibleLayers
member.summary: Gets the visibleLayers array (logic 1)

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.LayerTree.GetLayerVisibility(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the layer visibility (logic 2).

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.WebMap.LayerTree.SetLayerVisibility(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the layer visibility (logic 2).
